subject: PLDM : Multiple vmi certificate exchange
commitMessage:
PLDM : Multiple vmi certificate exchange

With this story PLDM detects interface added signal on interface
xyz.openbmc_project.Certs.Entry and saves the value of CSR property.
This CSR string is then sent to the host. Once the host responds to it
the response is verified and a client certificate received from host
is updates/saved in a dbus property - ClientCertificate.

For multiple certificate exchange, new dbus objects are
created for signing requests from different clients. Each dbus
object has properties such has CSR and Client certificate that get
updated with the certificate string when a valid CSR request is
sent to host and client certficate is received successfully.

After the dbus property (ClientCertificate) has a valid client
certificate string, status property of the dbus interface
xyz.openbmc_project.Certs.Entry is updated from pending to complete.

Signed-off-by: Varsha Kaverappa <vkaverap@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I63afb15190ae9c21eb86421d75f51618b358c074

Change has been successfully merged by Sampa Misra
I believe you were trying to add this code under file_io.hpp right ? With this code are you able to catch all the dbus signals ?
Please ignore this as I checked an older patchset

I see a handler change, this might impact all the tests when oem-ibm is enabled, please run the unit tests and update it in the commit message if they are running properly.

And also how was this change tested (using the busctl commands i presume), please mention how this was functionally tested from pldm & host POV.
we did not test with busctl, we run one curl commadn . there are no unit tests for this
this is too abstract statement, what i meant is , have you tested it with host ? if so , how ?
Please provide me a patch to test it . The last patch I got from you was a diff obj path

> Please provide me a patch to test it . The last patch I got from you was a diff obj path

done
is this still needed ? i think pldm should not create the directories like this , it should be replaced by dbus right ?

please modify path as /var/lib/ibm/bmcweb/.

Monoj,
for root cert we still rely on file. we have decided that no dbus object for root cert.

This is recent change we have decided.
please modify this entry path to "xyz/openbmc_project/certs/ca/entry"

This will be the signal generated when CSR created.

signal time=1619111735.917791 sender=:1.660 -> destination=(null destination)
 serial=68 path=/xyz/openbmc_project/certs/ca; interface=org.freedesktop.DBus.ObjectManager;
  member=InterfacesAdded
   object path "/xyz/openbmc_project/certs/ca/entry/6"
we are concatenating to CSR path to that string I cannot make it static
do we need a blocking call ?
no this is how it is done for dump offload also and it works good
what i meant was ...is there any reason why we cannot do an aync operation rather than sync operation ? because we had hit a lot of issues with having sync operations.
can you add file type as well here , so that we will know which file type file we could not send
there is only one file type that we send to host and that is the singing request type which is the CSR. So I feel it is understood CSR was not sent
I think signal should be monitored on object path /xyz/openbmc_project/certs/ca path not on entry path
not at all clear , please rephrase it

can we not contain this logic in the if (Property.first == "CSR") ? 

because, this would lead to called newCsrFileAvailabe even when we dont find the CSR property, with an empty string .

why did we pick this hierarchy now ?

@sampa  - i think last time Ed brought this point that we should not be hardcoding the paths like these in pldm code.

how will we know where to look for the cert files? Unlike dump offload VMI dbus operation does not have a dbus property that has path of cert file. the "ibm" was added after the bmcweb team asked us to change it please see older review comments from raviteja

Seems like we opened a file /var/lib/ibm/bmcweb/ClientCert,
then we created a stingstream,

but we did not copy the data that we got from host into this file ? this does not look correct to me. is this unit tested ?

@sampa thoughts ?

are we trying to replace /var/lib/ibm/bmcweb/ClientCert everytime ? are we not having a unique file name for each cert ?

@manoj yes this is tested and it works.

On the second point , we can have a unique file name for each client cert since the file handle is unique but we must do that with coordination with phyp team since they create this file.

Please see the output I got from test we ran with traces in pldm code
this cannot be created with default permissions , need to restrict the permission on who can access this directory.
whats is the typical size of the csr string ? why cant we just send the buffer instead of putting it in a file and sending it ?(if the csr is small)

I think phyp expects a file operation . Once we write the string to a file we send new file request , host responds to this with new file available and read . This whole communication with host has to be changed if we send the buffer
do we really need a blocking call here ?
this will be addressed in a separate commit
file remains there in error scenario ?
file remains there in error scenario ?
this is not error scenario ? also do we need to keep in info log ?
